title: Inside the VERY invasive Big Brother 2020 application
text:
Applications for the upcoming season of Big Brother are officially open.

And Aussies keen for a shot on the reality show will need to reveal every aspect of themselves in the lengthy and invasive online application form.

From revealing what you hate about your parents to discussing your views on religion and monogamy, absolutely nothing is off limits.

Do you have what it takes? Aussies keen for a shot on Big Brother 2020 will need to reveal every aspect of themselves in the lengthy and invasive online application form

Perhaps in an attempt to figure out how confrontational and dramatic housemates will be, the application form includes countless questions about potential triggers.

'When did you last lose your temper?' reads one question, while another asks how you would react if someone shouted at you.

Applicants must also reveal their phobias, any personal enemies they have, and any money they may owe to others.

'Are you religious?' From revealing what you hate about your parents to discussing your views on religion and monogamy, absolutely nothing is off limits. Pictured: Tim Dormer

If that wasn't bad enough, producers also want you to reveal everything about your friends and family, including the names and ages of siblings, how many close friends you have, and what your childhood was like.

For the health section of the questionnaire, applicants must disclose past and present drug use, mental illness and if they've ever seen a therapist and why.

There's also a list of questions related to life inside the Big Brother house, including where your moral boundaries lie and your strengths and weaknesses in social situations.

Moral dilemma: There's also a list of questions related to life inside the Big Brother house, including where your moral boundaries lie. Pictured: Tully Smyth and Anthony Drew

Endemol Shine launched the casting process for Big Brother 2020 on Thursday.

The applications opened just a day after TV Blackbox reported that Channel Seven had purchased rights to the format.

The deal was apparently made after Channels Nine and 10 rejected offers from production company Endemol Shine.

Are YOU the next Skye Wheatley? Endemol Shine opened the casting process for Channel Seven's 2020 Big Brother reboot on Thursday night

Big Brother, which was filmed at the Dreamworld amusement park on the Gold Coast, premiered in 2001 and lasted for eight seasons on Channel 10.

Following a significant decline in ratings and several high-profile controversies, Channel 10 decided not to renew the series.

In 2012, the format was revived by Channel Nine with Sonia Kruger as host and aired until 2014.
description: Applications for the upcoming season of Big Brother are officially open.
